data.title: Great quick meal!
data.text: Stopped by with my husband to try a gyro and was pleasantly surprised! It was strange to eat at a table by the sidewalk but the gyros were so good it didn't matter. The owner was friendly and served us with smile😃. You definitely need to check this place out if you're driving west on Cape Coral Parkway.

data.title: Great location and great food
data.text: Stopped in this past weekend with the family great gyros and friendly staff thank you for making our day a blast.

data.title: Company policy appalling, my Gyro was good!!
data.text:
I am a Cape Coral resident who frequented this food truck because I really enjoyed the Gyro, but also a customer at Napa Auto Center, so that made it easy to grab a bite.
After several visits I was offered a card that would be stamped with every purchase made, after a certain amount you are given one for free or an offer similar, so why not, sounds great, have done this with many establishments.
Here's the kicker...
The very next time I went I ordered the buy 3 get 4th free...when I handed them my card I was informed you can't get credit on any specials. 
I was paying for 3, so I asked for even one stamp NO GO and they stood firm. This is absurd.
This is terrible customer service and have not been back, it's really unfortunate.
I have been in the service industry myself for over 30 years and have never met with a more appalling policy in my life
This is definitely not how you retain customers, especially the year round crowd.

data.title: OK is being generous
data.text:
I stopped there because of the flyers that had been around town, its a trailer in a car park so there is not much I can say about the atmosphere other than you are standing and eating in a car park!
The Gyro was ok I have had better (frozen) from Publix's, I will not be going again you are better off grabbing a 'fast food' burger!

data.title: Disappointed....
data.text: The flyer said "Best in Town".....Not close!  The girl working looked like she hated her life and the fact that I showed up wanting to eat there.    I ordered the Schnitzel sandwich and got it dried and cut up in a pita with no flavor.  The Gyro is not fresh (neither was the Schnitzel) and looks like it came as a frozen patty.   I was starving but won't even eat this.  It was cheap....but for obvious reasons. We should have went to Nellys Taste of Greece in North Cape.

data.title: Fabulous Find
data.text:
Don't miss the truck parked three buildings east of Iguana Mia - in the NAPA parking lot. It is incredibly good! 

The German guy who runs the truck is a gem: so friendly, joyous & funny. The girl working there (from Ohio) was equally charming. They quickly prepared our food to order & I was amazed by how positively fresh & tasty our gyros were! (I was apprehensive when I approached the truck expecting maybe unsanitary conditions or something odd or disgusting. How wrong was I! It is scrupulously clean & they have a large fridge onboard. The gyros are not made ahead and kept in a warmer - they are grilled on the truck!) 

Our perfectly fresh pitas were grilled exactly right. The tomatoes were fresher than the tomatoes I bought at the nice (not big box discount) grocery store yesterday. The gyro meat was excellent - high quality, peppery & spicy without being overwhelming. I would love to report about the tzatziki sauce, but I ordered it on the side fearing it might be watery & ruin the gyro. It was not a bit watery - it was fresh & firm. However, I was enjoying my gyro so much I forgot to dip it into the tzatziki! Oh well, it is a good excuse to return next Spring Break!

He has a special buy 3, get one free, so we thought to buy extras for our El Salvadorian friends who live in Cape Coral. Our friends had never heard of this place and did not know what gyros are. Guess what? They absolutely love these gyros & were sure to get the exact location from us so they can return! 

If an El Salvadorian grandma who has never heard of a gyro loves this place you might want to give it a try, too. Seriously delicious!

data.title: Was fuer ein NEPP
data.text: Gyros streifen geschnitten so dick wie ein Schnitzel und dann eingefroren. Jetzt kommt der Gast. Ein Gyros bitte! Der Wirt holt das tiefgefrorene Gyros aus dem Froster packt es auf einen Grill und dann ab damit aufs Brot. Muss man mehr erzaehlen. Wo kommt der nur her?
